Display_Text.Text: Wait 6 minutes for Eldridge to call in.

We lost someone special today. %1$s, you will not be forgotten. - %2$s

The new group we brought in didn't last, but I'm glad we tried to help them. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Lily's trying to pick up the pieces.

TutorialText.Text: SNACKS aren't enough to combat long-standing HUNGER.

DescriptionText.Text: Glad we got some real food. It was getting hard to stay alert. - %1$s
No longer Weak with Hunger. (-1 Daily Ration of Food)

TutorialText.Text: Skillful feats like a one-shot multikill provide a big XP boost.

DescriptionText.Text: Taking out multiple zeds with one shot... Now that takes some real skill. - %1$s

TutorialText.Text: Skillful feats like a headshot streak provide a big XP boost.

DescriptionText.Text: I had this crazy streak of headshots just now. I must be getting better at shooting. - %1$s

TutorialText.Text: Skillful feats like a Slaughter provide a big XP boost.

DescriptionText.Text: A zed's not much of a threat one-on-one, but taking a bunch out in close quarters takes skill. - %1$s

TutorialText.Text: Skillful feats like a Slaughter provide a big XP boost.

DescriptionText.Text: A zed's not much of a threat one-on-one, but taking a bunch out in close quarters takes skill. - %1$s

DescriptionText.Text: A zed's not much of a threat one-on-one, but taking a bunch out in close quarters takes skill. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Bonus XP for Hack n Slash

DescriptionText.Text: Your DAILY INFLUENCE is limited by your FAME. You can temporarily earn more Influence, but it will gradually diminish if it exceeds your Fame.
Earn and spend this every day. Use it or lose it.
Gradually gain Fame with special achievements.

TutorialText.Text: Excess resources won't last through the night.

DescriptionText.Text: We have more FOOD than we'll be able to store. - %1$s
FOOD is key for keeping the community alive.

TutorialText.Text: Excess resources won't last through the night.

DescriptionText.Text: We have more FUEL than we'll be able to store. - %1$s
FUEL is useful for making weapons and keeping generators running.

TutorialText.Text: Excess resources won't last through the night.

DescriptionText.Text: We have more MATERIALS than we'll be able to store. - %1$s
MATERIALS are needed for construction and to keep our home secure.

TutorialText.Text: Excess resources won't last through the night.

DescriptionText.Text: We have more AMMO than we'll be able to store. - %1$s
AMMO is the primary trade currency and is key for survival.

TutorialText.Text: Excess resources won't last through the night.

DescriptionText.Text: We have more MEDICINE than we'll be able to store. - %1$s
MEDICINE is essential for resisting disease and speeding recovery.

TutorialText.Text: Use the Radio to select a new home site.

DescriptionText.Text: We shouldn't just move anywhere. We need to find a suitable location if we're going to move. - %1$s
A home site needs a defensible perimeter wall.
We'll need MATERIALS to fortify the walls.
We'd need enough people to defend the walls.

TutorialText.Text: The more outposts you have, the safer your home is.

DescriptionText.Text: After fully searching a building, I can radio home and have the guys set up an outpost.

SummaryText.Text: Look for "Establish Outpost" in the Radio.

DescriptionText.Text: Coordinating things at home.
15% chance of missing allies coming home safely on their own.
Increase protected range around the outpost.
Press [ul_radio_menu] to use your Radio.
Reckless actions, like setting an ally on fire, affect TRUST and ATTITUDE of those around you.
Completing missions helps, but you can also gain TRUST with individual actions like cheering someone on after a kill.

TutorialText.Text: Anyone who is GRAVELY WOUNDED is in danger of dying instead of recovering.

DescriptionText.Text: Community members who are Hurt have a chance to recover (or get worse) every day.
Having a good Medicine Stockpile improves Recovery Chance.
The better our medical facilities, the higher the Recovery Chance.
Having a community member with a medical background improves Recovery Chance.

TutorialText.Text: Anyone who is GRAVELY ILL is in danger of dying instead of recovering.

DescriptionText.Text: Community members who are Sick have a chance to recover (or get worse) every day.
Having a good Medicine Stockpile improves Recovery Chance.
The better our medical facilities, the higher the Recovery Chance.
Having a community member with a medical background improves Recovery Chance.
We can't stay at the church forever, but if we're going to move somewhere it needs a good defensible perimeter.

SummaryText.Text: Look for "Relocate Home" in the Radio.

TutorialText.Text: Attacks from Freak zombies or while you are on the ground reduce your Maximum Vitality.

DescriptionText.Text: Vitality drops whenever you get hurt. Taking serious damage lowers your Maximum Vitality.
Regain Vitality by numbing the pain.
To recover Max Vitality switch to someone else or take a break for the day.
Once zeds overrun a building, they'll continue to occupy it unless we clear them out.
The more Infestations out there, the more dangerous things are.
The more Infestations out there, the more dangerous things are.
Area of effect items like petrol bombs are good when taking on groups.
In life, the Miller cousins were big and ornery . In death, they're much the same.
Headshots still work, but it may take more than one.
Don't count on a car surviving an encounter with one of these guys.
Our best bet is immobilizing them with explosives.
Nearly all zeds behave in a primal, aggressive way, but FERAL ZEDS take it to another level.
The combination of speed and erratic movement can make them hard to shoot.
Incendiaries and explosives may be your best bet.
Drowning victims seem to come back as these toxic, BLOATED ZEDS.
Don't stand too close to one after taking it out. That gas is toxic.
Running one over might not be the best idea either.
Not much of a direct threat, but if you let a SCREAMER keep making noise, it'll bring a lot of zeds to the area.
At least one screamer can be found in any Infestation.
If you're careless about making noise, it's easy to attract a lot of zeds and get overwhelmed.
Any combat sounds draw attention, but gunfire is extremely loud. Use caution when firing a gun without a suppressor.
Cars make a lot of noise. When driving, consider parking AWAY from your destination so you don't draw zeds to you.
When you search rapidly, you risk breaking something and making a lot of noise.
Loud noises can be used to temporarily draw zeds away from you.
Safe only goes so far. Hordes can still wander through and noise can always draw zeds in.
Fully exploring a building creates a temporary safe area.
Expand the safe area around your home using a Watchtower.
Each Outpost creates a safe area around it.
Some days you wish people knew more survival techniques and less sports trivia.
Zombie Hordes move and become alerted as a group. Don't fight them if you don't have to.
Avoid the VISION CONE and don't make NOISE near a HORDE to prevent detection.

TutorialText.Text: You can radio home for SCAVENGERS instead and let someone else do the heavy lifting.

DescriptionText.Text: You can load up a Rucksack and carry it home to increase your community's stockpiles of Food, Medicine, Ammo, Materials, or Fuel.

SummaryText.Text: A way to bring resources home.

DescriptionText.Text: While carrying a Rucksack, you'll be Encumbered, wearing down your Max Stamina faster than normal.
You can also Break Open resources for immediate usage, but this destroys

DescriptionText.Text: %2$s has failed to recover from injury.
I am getting nothing but dead air, we will have to try again. Let me know when you want me to give it another go.

SummaryText.Text: Unable to contact any new survivors.

DescriptionText.Text: We found some of our missing community members. Unfortunately, the zeds got to them first.
We've managed to survive until another extraction, but this outbreak isn't getting any better. It's going to take all we've got to hold out for the next one.
There's something unnatural about this so-called Black Fever. No medicines seem to help. - %1$s
We let things get toxic in the community and now we've paid the price. - %1$s
It's always hard to lose someone. - %1$s
We've let the zeds overrun too much of valley. It's not safe. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: We've let the zeds overrun too much of valley. It's not safe. - %1$s

DescriptionText.Text: When we have freak sightings, we need to be more proactive about dealing with them. - %1$s
We let things get toxic in the community and now we've paid the price. - %1$s
Well, I guess we can stop worrying about philosophical differences about how to run the community. - %1$s
It's nice to see medical treatment work out. Everyone's breathing a sigh of relief. - %1$s
Our defenses managed to hold. Things could have been a lot worse. - %1$s
It's nice to see medical treatment work out. %2$s is feeling better and everyone's breathing a sigh of relief. - %1$s
It's nice to see medical treatment work out. Everyone's breathing a sigh of relief. - %1$s
We need to do something about our lack of beds. People aren't getting enough rest. - %1$s
When we don't have enough food for everyone, people go hungry. - %1$s

Another day, another round of foraging. - %1$s

Julene Horn is on the way to the capital with her husband's notes.
Survived the apocalypse ... so far.
Madison Grant is on the way to the capital. So is Brock.

SummaryText.Text: Safely in the air with Brock.

DescriptionText.Text: Survived the apocalypse ... so far.
Madison Grant is on the way to the capital.
Survived the apocalypse ... so far.
Brockworth "Brock" Brockway is on the way to the capital. (That's what I've decided his name was. He only introduced himself as Brock.)
Survived the apocalypse ... so far.
Dan Bogatz is on the way to the capital with his daughter Shira.

SummaryText.Text: Safely in the air with Shira.

DescriptionText.Text: Survived the apocalypse ... so far.
Dan Bogatz is on the way to the capital. We weren't able to save his daughter.

SummaryText.Text: Safely in the air ... but alone.

Shira Bogatz is on the way to the capital. We weren't able to save her father.

Hadley Westen is on the way to the capital.
Survived the apocalypse ... so far.
Vienna Cho has been keeping tabs on our efforts. Even she has to acknowledge that we're doing whatever we can to save civilians.

Console_Command.Command: LOG: Cho should be joining now.

DescriptionText.Text: Vienna Cho is broadcasting our failures to every survivor in the city. If we want to keep the population on our side, we're going to have to work harder.

SummaryText.Text: Civilians are disappointed in our work.

DescriptionText.Text: We managed to keep the asset alive until the helo got here.
We managed to keep the asset alive until the helo got here.
We managed to keep the asset alive until the helo got here.
We have a new commanding officer. Hopefully, they'll do a better job of staying alive than the last one. Check the Ops Center to see what the Colonel is capable of.

SummaryText.Text: We have a new CO in the Ops Center.

DescriptionText.Text: We have a new commanding officer. Hopefully, they'll do a better job of staying alive than the last one. Check the Ops Center to see what the Lieutenant Colonel is capable of.

SummaryText.Text: We have a new CO in the Ops Center.

DescriptionText.Text: We have a new commanding officer. Hopefully, they'll do a better job of staying alive than the last one. Check the Ops Center to see what the Major is capable of.

SummaryText.Text: We have a new CO in the Ops Center.

DescriptionText.Text: We have a new commanding officer. Hopefully, they'll do a better job of staying alive than the last one. Check the Ops Center to see what the Captain is capable of.

SummaryText.Text: We have a new CO in the Ops Center.

DescriptionText.Text: We have a new commanding officer. Hopefully, they'll do a better job of staying alive than the last one. Check the Ops Center to see what the Lieutenant is capable of.

SummaryText.Text: We have a new CO in the Ops Center.

DescriptionText.Text: We have a new commanding officer. Hopefully, they'll do a better job of staying alive than the last one. Check the Ops Center to see what this Warrant Officer is capable of.

SummaryText.Text: We have a new CO in the Ops Center.

DescriptionText.Text: We've got a Sergeant running the show now. Check out the Ops Center to see what they're capable of.

SummaryText.Text: We're down to NCO's leading this operation.

DescriptionText.Text: We've got a Corporal running the show now. Check out the Ops Center to see what they're capable of.

SummaryText.Text: We're down to NCO's leading this operation.

DescriptionText.Text: We don't have enough soldiers left to go on risky scavenging missions.
We've been searching the area near the base for additional supplies, but we're coming up empty. It's too early to give up, though.
Thanks to some solid tactical planning, we've managed to recover some food from the surrounding area.
Thanks to some solid tactical planning, we've managed to recover some much-needed medical supplies from the surrounding area.
Thanks to some solid tactical planning, we've managed to recover several boxes of ammunition from the surrounding area.
Thanks to some solid tactical planning, we've managed to recover some construction materials from the surrounding area.
Thanks to some solid tactical planning, we've managed to recover some usable fuel from the surrounding area.
We don't have enough soldiers left to go on risky zombie hunts.
We had to pull back during our last zombie-hunting expedition, without really making a dent in their numbers.
We're not making much headway against the zombies around the base, but we may have bought ourselves an extra minute.
We managed to clear out a few of the nearby areas. It'll take them a bit longer to build up to siege levels now.
We took down a couple of hordes from a distance without any casualties. It'll take them significantly longer to build up critical mass for a siege.
We don't have enough soldiers left to go on risky rescue missions.
We've found a lot of bodies, but no reinforcements. We haven't given up hope, though.
We found %1$s holed up in the city. We're glad to have another rifle on our side, and they're just glad to be alive.
Ready to have our backs.
Very short rifle, good for indoors but can be hard to tame.
The CS has a longer barrel for stability and scope.
Tactical police rifle made in Switzerland.
Russian reliability that chambers NATO rounds.
A popular battle rifle worldwide for over 50 years.
The "C" stands for "Compact", the shorter brother to the G36.
Based on the AK design, this is a battle tested and reliable weapon.
A new bullpup battle rifle, fitted with an optic for high visibility at range.
New bullpup from Israel. Compact, accurate and reliable.
Designed and built in Czechoslovakia until the mid 1980s.
This next-generation rifle has an integrated optics package.
A lightweight, polymer .45 caliber pistol made for the civilian market.
A military and police oriented version of the F45, match barrel and optic.
Light weight polymer, accurate and reliable. Enough said.
Very reliable with RDSS sight system.
Groomed for combat and comes with a threaded barrel.
An accurate and iconic collector's firearm. Be sure to keep it clean!
A special collector's item. Captured in WW II by a special G.I.
This 870 is a tsunami of aftermarket parts by Schmidt Tactical. Inscribed with the word "Odin".
The long barrel on this 870 and custom parts make this a very accurate shotgun. Inscribed, "Gungnir".
Designed by the incredible J. Browning, this innovative lever action shotgun is a work of art.
Modern manufacture of the classic 1887, made popular by movies and video games.
Factory tacti-cool .22 varmint gun, with optic. In case the squirrels attack!
A venerable combat rifle used by the US military over a period of 70 years.
Pinpoint accuracy at long range, this rifle is a huge success in military units.
A veteran of many wars, this rifle can be found all over the world.
The pinnacle of precision M14 evolution to date. this version is custom to the Red Talon group.
The M110 Semi-Automatic Sniper System, due to replace the M24 system.
A brand new bullpup rifle with a unique forward ejection system. Stock sights.
A new, innovative bullpup. This one includes a suite of optics.
A folding, semi-auto survival rifle. Accurate but not meant for heavy use.
A long-time Cold Warrior, this rifle was often used in a sniper role. Sadly, this one has no scope.
All T21 rifles are made to easily convert between 9mm and 5.56mm.
9mm revolvers made in the US are rare, now you have one!
Familiar pistol silhouette of the 92 series produced as a full-auto SMG.
Full-auto paired with the usual Bz 75 excellence. Spare mag is fitted as a foregrip.
A full-auto version of the G17 with a high capactiy magazine, calssified as an SMG.
This modern firearm is the spiritual successor to the great Czech gun engineers.
Technically a pistol, firing a rifle round, classified as an SMG. Did you get all that? Optic added.
The Swiss are still finding a niche for new SMGs with their latest offering. Optic included.
Model 1100 for police and military use. INCENDIARY.
A reliable military shotgun. INCENDIARY.
An AK 47 and a shotgun had a baby. INCENDIARY.
Low profile, slim but brutal. INCENDIARY.
Unique, cylinder-fed police shotgun. INCENDIARY.

TutorialText.Text: Situation Reports tell you how the world beyond Danforth is coping.

DescriptionText.Text: The latest update from Capt. Montressor in Trumbull Valley is overdue. The success of Operation: Washout may be jeopardized.

TutorialText.Text: Situation Reports tell you how the world beyond Danforth is coping.

DescriptionText.Text: Intermittent civilian radio signals picked up from Trumbull Valley. Could be a provisional government asserting control of the situation.

TutorialText.Text: Situation Reports tell you how the world beyond Danforth is coping.

DescriptionText.Text: Last remaining personnel evacuated from Trumbull Containment Barrier. Operation: Boxtop officially abandoned.

TutorialText.Text: Situation Reports tell you how the world beyond Danforth is coping.

DescriptionText.Text: Unconfirmed reports of one or more large explosions between Danforth and Trumbull Valley. No scouting resources available to investigate at this time.

TutorialText.Text: Situation Reports tell you how the world beyond Danforth is coping.

DescriptionText.Text: Troops at Fairgrounds FOB report civilian contact. Refugees from Marshall may have entered Fairfield Quarantine Zone.

TutorialText.Text: Situation Reports tell you how the world beyond Danforth is coping.

DescriptionText.Text: Massive detonation reported from the vicinity of the Trumbull Containment Barrier. Wall breach suspected.
The pilot dropped off a box of MREs that he scavenged from HQ. Should help us hold out for a bit longer.
A good pilot always delivers.
The pilot dropped off a box of ammo that he scavenged from HQ. Should help us hold out for a bit longer.
A good pilot always delivers.
The pilot dropped off a box of medical supplies that he scavenged from HQ. Should help us hold out for a bit longer.
A good pilot always delivers.
The pilot dropped off a stack of construction materials that he scavenged from HQ. Should help us hold out for a bit longer.
A good pilot always delivers.
The pilot dropped off some extra fuel that he scavenged from HQ. Should help us hold out for a bit longer.
A good pilot always delivers.
I thought it was over for me, but someone from the unit happened by and brought me back to base. I can't believe I came so close. From now on, every moment is precious.

SummaryText.Text: I was at death's door, but someone pulled me out.

LifelineShowScore.Text: Nice work! You saved a lot of people.

Console_Command.Command: LOG: WE ASSERT THAT THERE ARE NO VIPs!
LOG: WTF why are there three or more VIPs?
LOG: OH NOES we have 2 VIPs!
LOG: Okay, we still have ONE VIP for some reason.
LOG: ==== CLEO: CleoDrop - Second Mission Scene ====
LOG: ==== CLEO: CleoDrop - Second Mission Triggered ====

DescriptionText.Text: A young woman showed up at our gate today with a rucksack full of supplies. She said she was here to help, so we welcomed her in. It's not easy to trust people these days, but she has an honest face, and what seems to be a genuine desire to do good.
Gurubani added 4 Food, 4 Medicine, and 60 rounds of 7.62mm ammunition to our Supply Locker.
The Prepper SUV has been delivered to a location near the base.
The SKS Prepper rifle and the Folding Axe have been delivered into our supply locker.
